trans-unit.source: Find-Script
trans-unit.target: Find-Script

trans-unit.source: Finds the PowerShell script files from an online gallery that match specified criteria.
trans-unit.target: Finds the PowerShell script files from an online gallery that match specified criteria.

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Find-Script discovers the script files from registered repositories that matches the specified criteria.
trans-unit.target: Find-Script discovers the script files from registered repositories that matches the specified criteria.

trans-unit.source: For each script found, Find-Script returns a PSRepositoryItemInfo object which can optionally be piped to Install-Script for installing the scripts.
trans-unit.target: For each script found, Find-Script returns a PSRepositoryItemInfo object which can optionally be piped to Install-Script for installing the scripts.

trans-unit.source: Find-Script cmdlet lets you to discover the script files with different search criteria like name, tag, filter, command name, version range, exact version, all versions, including its dependencies and from specific or all registered repositories.
trans-unit.target: Find-Script cmdlet lets you to discover the script files with different search criteria like name, tag, filter, command name, version range, exact version, all versions, including its dependencies and from specific or all registered repositories.

trans-unit.source: Find-Script can filter based on script contents with the -Command and -Includes parameters.
trans-unit.target: Find-Script can filter based on script contents with the -Command and -Includes parameters.

trans-unit.source: Find-Script can filter with version parameters: MinimumVersion, MaximumVersion, RequiredVersion, AllVersions.
trans-unit.target: Find-Script can filter with version parameters: MinimumVersion, MaximumVersion, RequiredVersion, AllVersions.

trans-unit.source: These parameters are mutually exclusive, except MinmimumVersion and MaximumVersion.
trans-unit.target: These parameters are mutually exclusive, except MinmimumVersion and MaximumVersion.

trans-unit.source: These version parameters are allowed only with the single script name without any wildcards.
trans-unit.target: These version parameters are allowed only with the single script name without any wildcards.

trans-unit.source: If the RequiredVersion parameter is not specified, Find-Script returns the latest version of the script that is equal to or greater than the minimum version specified or the latest version of the script if no minimum version is specified.
trans-unit.target: If the RequiredVersion parameter is not specified, Find-Script returns the latest version of the script that is equal to or greater than the minimum version specified or the latest version of the script if no minimum version is specified.

trans-unit.source: If the RequiredVersion parameter is specified, Find-Script only returns the version of script that exactly matches the specified version.
trans-unit.target: If the RequiredVersion parameter is specified, Find-Script only returns the version of script that exactly matches the specified version.

trans-unit.source: Find-Script can filter on script metadata with the -Tag parameter.
trans-unit.target: Find-Script can filter on script metadata with the -Tag parameter.

trans-unit.source: Find-Script can filter on repository-specific search language with the -Filter parameter.
trans-unit.target: Find-Script can filter on repository-specific search language with the -Filter parameter.

trans-unit.source: Find-Script can filter on scripts from all or few of the registered repositories.
trans-unit.target: Find-Script can filter on scripts from all or few of the registered repositories.

trans-unit.source: **NOTE:** Registered PSRepository should have a valid ScriptSourceLocation.
trans-unit.target: **NOTE:** Registered PSRepository should have a valid ScriptSourceLocation.

trans-unit.source: You can use the Set-PSRepository to set ScriptSourceLocation value.
trans-unit.target: You can use the Set-PSRepository to set ScriptSourceLocation value.

trans-unit.source: Cmdlet syntax
trans-unit.target: Cmdlet syntax

trans-unit.target: Cmdlet online help reference
